AssociateWhatsAppBusinessAccount.name: AssociateWhatsAppBusinessAccount
AssociateWhatsAppBusinessAccount.documentation: This is only used through the Amazon Web Services console during sign-up to associate your WhatsApp Business Account to your Amazon Web Services account.

CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplate.name: CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplate
CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplate.documentation: Creates a new WhatsApp message template from a custom definition.

CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplateFromLibrary.name: CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplateFromLibrary
CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplateFromLibrary.documentation: Creates a new WhatsApp message template using a template from Meta's template library.

CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplateMedia.name: CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplateMedia
CreateWhatsAppMessageTemplateMedia.documentation: Uploads media for use in a WhatsApp message template.

DeleteWhatsAppMessageMedia.name: DeleteWhatsAppMessageMedia
DeleteWhatsAppMessageMedia.documentation: Delete a media object from the WhatsApp service. If the object is still in an Amazon S3 bucket you should delete it from there too.

DisassociateWhatsAppBusinessAccount.name: DisassociateWhatsAppBusinessAccount
DisassociateWhatsAppBusinessAccount.documentation: Disassociate a WhatsApp Business Account (WABA) from your Amazon Web Services account.

GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount.name: GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount
GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount.documentation: Get the details of your linked WhatsApp Business Account.

GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccountPhoneNum.name: GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccountPhoneNumber
GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccountPhoneNum.documentation: Use your WhatsApp phone number id to get the WABA account id and phone number details.

GetWhatsAppMessageMedia.name: GetWhatsAppMessageMedia
GetWhatsAppMessageMedia.documentation: Get a media file from the WhatsApp service. On successful completion the media file is retrieved from Meta and stored in the specified Amazon S3 bucket. Use either destinationS3File or destinationS3PresignedUrl for the destination. If both are used then an InvalidParameterException is returned.

ListLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccounts.name: ListLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccounts
ListLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccounts.documentation: List all WhatsApp Business Accounts linked to your Amazon Web Services account.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: List all tags associated with a resource, such as a phone number or WABA.

ListWhatsAppMessageTemplates.name: ListWhatsAppMessageTemplates
ListWhatsAppMessageTemplates.documentation: Lists WhatsApp message templates for a specific WhatsApp Business Account.

ListWhatsAppTemplateLibrary.name: ListWhatsAppTemplateLibrary
ListWhatsAppTemplateLibrary.documentation: Lists templates available in Meta's template library for WhatsApp messaging.

PostWhatsAppMessageMedia.name: PostWhatsAppMessageMedia
PostWhatsAppMessageMedia.documentation: Upload a media file to the WhatsApp service. Only the specified originationPhoneNumberId has the permissions to send the media file when using SendWhatsAppMessage. You must use either sourceS3File or sourceS3PresignedUrl for the source. If both or neither are specified then an InvalidParameterException is returned.

PutWhatsAppBusinessAccountEventDestinati.name: PutWhatsAppBusinessAccountEventDestinations
PutWhatsAppBusinessAccountEventDestinati.documentation: Add an event destination to log event data from WhatsApp for a WhatsApp Business Account (WABA). A WABA can only have one event destination at a time. All resources associated with the WABA use the same event destination.

SendWhatsAppMessage.name: SendWhatsAppMessage
SendWhatsAppMessage.documentation: Send a WhatsApp message. For examples of sending a message using the Amazon Web Services CLI, see Sending messages in the Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social User Guide .

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds or overwrites only the specified tags for the specified resource. When you specify an existing tag key, the value is overwritten with the new value.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes the specified tags from a resource.

AccessDeniedByMetaException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

setupFinalization.documentation: A JSON object that contains the phone numbers and WhatsApp Business Account to link to your account.

metaLibraryTemplate.documentation: The template configuration from Meta's library, including customizations for buttons and body text.

id.documentation: The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account to associate with this template.

metaTemplateId.documentation: The numeric ID assigned to the template by Meta.

templateStatus.documentation: The status of the created template (for example, PENDING or APPROVED).

category.documentation: The category of the template (for example, UTILITY or MARKETING).

templateDefinition.documentation: The complete template definition as a JSON blob.

id.documentation: The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account to associate with this template.
The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account associated with this media upload.

metaHeaderHandle.documentation: The handle assigned to the uploaded media by Meta, used to reference the media in templates.

metaTemplateId.documentation: The numeric ID assigned to the template by Meta.

templateStatus.documentation: The status of the created template, such as PENDING or APPROVED..

category.documentation: The category of the template, such as UTILITY or MARKETING.

mediaId.documentation: The unique identifier of the media file to delete. Use the mediaId returned from PostWhatsAppMessageMedia.

originationPhoneNumberId.documentation: The unique identifier of the originating phone number associated with the media. Phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

success.documentation: Success indicator for deleting the media file.

metaTemplateId.documentation: The numeric ID of the template assigned by Meta.

deleteAllLanguages.documentation: If true, deletes all language versions of the template.

id.documentation: The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account associated with this template.

templateName.documentation: The name of the template to delete.

DependencyException.documentation: Thrown when performing an action because a dependency would be broken.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of your WhatsApp Business Account. WABA identifiers are formatted as waba-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use ListLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccounts to list all WABAs and their details.

The unique identifier, from Amazon Web Services, of the linked WhatsApp Business Account. WABA identifiers are formatted as waba-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use ListLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccounts to list all WABAs and their details.

account.documentation: The details of the linked WhatsApp Business Account.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the phone number. Phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

linkedWhatsAppBusinessAccountId.documentation: The WABA identifier linked to the phone number, formatted as waba-01234567890123456789012345678901.

mediaId.documentation: The unique identifier for the media file.

originationPhoneNumberId.documentation: The unique identifier of the originating phone number for the WhatsApp message media. The phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

metadataOnly.documentation: Set to True to get only the metadata for the file.

destinationS3PresignedUrl.documentation: The presign url of the media file.

destinationS3File.documentation: The bucketName and key of the S3 media file.

fileSize.documentation: The file size of the media, in KB.

metaTemplateId.documentation: The numeric ID of the template assigned by Meta.

id.documentation: The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account associated with this template.

template.documentation: The complete template definition as a JSON string (maximum 6000 characters).

InternalServiceException.documentation: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception, or failure.

InvalidParametersException.documentation: One or more parameters provided to the action are not valid.

addContactNumber.documentation: When true, includes a contact number in the template body.

addLearnMoreLink.documentation: When true, includes a "learn more" link in the template body.

addSecurityRecommendation.documentation: When true, includes security recommendations in the template body.

addTrackPackageLink.documentation: When true, includes a package tracking link in the template body.

codeExpirationMinutes.documentation: The number of minutes until a verification code or OTP expires.

LibraryTemplateBodyInputs.documentation: Configuration options for customizing the body content of a template from Meta's library.

type.documentation: The type of button (for example, QUICK_REPLY, CALL, or URL).

phoneNumber.documentation: The phone number in E.164 format for CALL-type buttons.

url.documentation: The URL with dynamic parameters for URL-type buttons.

otpType.documentation: The type of one-time password for OTP buttons.

zeroTapTermsAccepted.documentation: When true, indicates acceptance of zero-tap terms for the button.

supportedApps.documentation: List of supported applications for this button type.

LibraryTemplateButtonInput.documentation: Configuration options for customizing buttons in a template from Meta's library.

type.documentation: The type of button (for example, QUICK_REPLY, CALL, or URL).

text.documentation: The text displayed on the button (maximum 40 characters).

phoneNumber.documentation: The phone number in E.164 format for CALL-type buttons.

otpType.documentation: The type of one-time password for OTP buttons.

zeroTapTermsAccepted.documentation: When true, indicates acceptance of zero-tap terms for the button.

supportedApps.documentation: List of supported applications for this button type.

LibraryTemplateButtonList.documentation: Defines a button in a template from Meta's library.

LimitExceededException.documentation: The request was denied because it would exceed one or more service quotas or limits.

eventDestinations.documentation: The event destinations for the linked WhatsApp Business Account.

unregisteredWhatsAppPhoneNumbers.documentation: The details for unregistered WhatsApp phone numbers.

LinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccountIdMetaData.documentation: Contains your WhatsApp registration status and details of any unregistered WhatsApp phone number.

arn.documentation: The ARN of the linked WhatsApp Business Account.

id.documentation: The ID of the linked WhatsApp Business Account, formatted as waba-01234567890123456789012345678901.

linkedAccounts.documentation: A list of WhatsApp Business Accounts linked to your Amazon Web Services account.

id.documentation: The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account to list templates for.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next page of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return per page (1-100).

nextToken.documentation: The token to retrieve the next page of results, if any.
The token for the next page of results.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return per page (1-100).

filters.documentation: Map of filters to apply (searchKey, topic, usecase, industry, language).

metaLibraryTemplates.documentation: A list of templates from Meta's library.

nextToken.documentation: The token to retrieve the next page of results, if any.

templateName.documentation: The name to assign to the template.

libraryTemplateName.documentation: The name of the template in Meta's library.

templateCategory.documentation: The category of the template (for example, UTILITY or MARKETING).

templateLanguage.documentation: The language code for the template (for example, en_US).

MetaLibraryTemplate.documentation: Represents a template from Meta's library with customization options.

templateLanguage.documentation: The language code for the template (for example, en_US).

templateCategory.documentation: The category of the template (for example, UTILITY or MARKETING).

templateTopic.documentation: The topic or subject matter of the template.

templateUseCase.documentation: The intended use case for the template.

templateIndustry.documentation: The industries the template is designed for.

templateId.documentation: The ID of the template in Meta's library.

MetaLibraryTemplateDefinition.documentation: Defines the complete structure and content of a template in Meta's library.

originationPhoneNumberId.documentation: The ID of the phone number to associate with the WhatsApp media file. The phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

sourceS3PresignedUrl.documentation: The source presign url of the media file.

sourceS3File.documentation: The source S3 url for the media file.

mediaId.documentation: The unique identifier of the posted WhatsApp message.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of your WhatsApp Business Account. WABA identifiers are formatted as waba-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use ListLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccounts to list all WABAs and their details.

key.documentation: The object key of the media file.

S3File.documentation: Contains information for the S3 bucket that contains media files.

headers.documentation: A map of headers and their values. You must specify the Content-Type header when using PostWhatsAppMessageMedia. For a list of common headers, see Common Request Headers in the Amazon S3 API Reference

S3PresignedUrl.documentation: You can use presigned URLs to grant time-limited access to objects in Amazon S3 without updating your bucket policy. For more information, see Working with presigned URLs in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

originationPhoneNumberId.documentation: The ID of the phone number used to send the WhatsApp message. If you are sending a media file only the originationPhoneNumberId used to upload the file can be used. Phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

message.documentation: The message to send through WhatsApp. The length is in KB. The message field passes through a WhatsApp Message object, see Messages in the WhatsApp Business Platform Cloud API Reference.

metaApiVersion.documentation: The API version for the request formatted as v{VersionNumber}. For a list of supported API versions and Amazon Web Services Regions, see Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API Service Endpoints in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to tag.

tags.documentation: The tags to add to the resource.

statusCode.documentation: The status code of the tag resource operation.

metaTemplateId.documentation: The numeric ID assigned to the template by Meta.

templateStatus.documentation: The current status of the template (for example, APPROVED, PENDING, or REJECTED).

templateQualityScore.documentation: The quality score assigned to the template by Meta.

templateLanguage.documentation: The language code of the template (for example, en_US).

templateCategory.documentation: The category of the template (for example, UTILITY or MARKETING).

TemplateSummary.documentation: Provides a summary of a WhatsApp message template's key attributes.

ThrottledRequestException.documentation: The request was denied due to request throttling.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove tags from.

tagKeys.documentation: The keys of the tags to remove from the resource.

statusCode.documentation: The status code of the untag resource operation.

id.documentation: The ID of the WhatsApp Business Account associated with this template.

metaTemplateId.documentation: The numeric ID of the template assigned by Meta.

templateCategory.documentation: The new category for the template (for example, UTILITY or MARKETING).

templateComponents.documentation: The updated components of the template as a JSON blob (maximum 3000 characters).

ValidationException.documentation: The request contains an invalid parameter value.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the originating phone number associated with the media. Phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

twoFactorPin.documentation: The PIN to use for two-step verification. To reset your PIN follow the directions in Updating PIN in the WhatsApp Business Platform Cloud API Reference.

dataLocalizationRegion.documentation:
The two letter ISO region for the location of where Meta will store data.

AsiaPacific (APAC)

  • Australia AU

  • Indonesia ID

  • India IN

  • Japan JP

  • Singapore SG

  • South Korea KR

Europe

  • Germany DE

  • Switzerland CH

  • United Kingdom GB

Latin America (LATAM)

  • Brazil BR

Middle East and Africa (MEA)

  • Bahrain BH

  • South Africa ZA

  • United Arab Emirates AE

North America (NORAM)

  • Canada CA

tags.documentation: An array of key and value pair tags.

WabaPhoneNumberSetupFinalization.documentation: The registration details for a linked phone number.

id.documentation: The ID of the linked WhatsApp Business Account, formatted as waba-01234567890123456789012345678901.

eventDestinations.documentation: The event destinations for the linked WhatsApp Business Account.

tags.documentation: An array of key and value pair tags.

WabaSetupFinalization.documentation: The registration details for a linked WhatsApp Business Account.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Identity and Access Management role that is able to import phone numbers and write events.

arn.documentation: The ARN of the WhatsApp phone number.

phoneNumberId.documentation: The phone number ID. Phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901.

displayPhoneNumberName.documentation: The display name for this phone number.

displayPhoneNumber.documentation: The phone number that appears in the recipients display.

qualityRating.documentation: The quality rating of the phone number.

dataLocalizationRegion.documentation: The geographic region where the WhatsApp phone number's data is stored and processed.

WhatsAppPhoneNumberDetail.documentation: The details of your WhatsApp phone number.

arn.documentation: The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the phone number.

phoneNumber.documentation: The phone number associated with the Linked WhatsApp Business Account.

phoneNumberId.documentation: The phone number ID. Phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901.

displayPhoneNumberName.documentation: The display name for this phone number.

displayPhoneNumber.documentation: The phone number that appears in the recipients display.

qualityRating.documentation: The quality rating of the phone number. This is from Meta.

dataLocalizationRegion.documentation: The geographic region where the WhatsApp phone number's data is stored and processed.

WhatsAppPhoneNumberSummary.documentation: The details of a linked phone number.

associateInProgressToken.documentation: An Amazon Web Services access token generated by WhatsAppSignupCallback and used by WhatsAppSetupFinalization.

phoneNumbers.documentation: An array of WabaPhoneNumberSetupFinalization objects containing the details of each phone number associated with the WhatsApp Business Account.

phoneNumberParent.documentation: Used to add a new phone number to an existing WhatsApp Business Account. This field can't be used when the waba field is present.

waba.documentation: Used to create a new WhatsApp Business Account and add a phone number. This field can't be used when the phoneNumberParent field is present.

WhatsAppSetupFinalization.documentation: The details of linking a WhatsApp Business Account to your Amazon Web Services account.

accessToken.documentation: The access token for your WhatsApp Business Account. The accessToken value is provided by Meta.

callbackUrl.documentation: The URL where WhatsApp will send callback notifications for this account.

WhatsAppSignupCallback.documentation: Contains the accessToken provided by Meta during signup.

associateInProgressToken.documentation: An Amazon Web Services access token generated by WhatsAppSignupCallback and used by WhatsAppSetupFinalization.

linkedAccountsWithIncompleteSetup.documentation: A LinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccountIdMetaData object map containing the details of any WhatsAppBusiness accounts that have incomplete setup.

documentation:
Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social, also referred to as Social messaging, is a messaging service that enables application developers to incorporate WhatsApp into their existing workflows. The Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API provides information about the Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API resources, including supported HTTP methods, parameters, and schemas.

The Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API provides programmatic access to options that are unique to the WhatsApp Business Platform.

If you're new to the Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API, it's also helpful to review What is Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social in the Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social User Guide. The Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social User Guide provides tutorials, code samples, and procedures that demonstrate how to use Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API features programmatically and how to integrate functionality into applications. The guide also provides key information, such as integration with other Amazon Web Services services, and the quotas that apply to use of the service.

Regional availability

The Amazon Web Services End User Messaging Social API is available across several Amazon Web Services Regions and it provides a dedicated endpoint for each of these Regions. For a list of all the Regions and endpoints where the API is currently available, see Amazon Web Services Service Endpoints and Amazon Web Services End User Messaging endpoints and quotas in the Amazon Web Services General Reference. To learn more about Amazon Web Services Regions, see Managing Amazon Web Services Regions in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

In each Region, Amazon Web Services maintains multiple Availability Zones. These Availability Zones are physically isolated from each other, but are united by private, low-latency, high-throughput, and highly redundant network connections. These Availability Zones enable us to provide very high levels of availability and redundancy, while also minimizing latency. To learn more about the number of Availability Zones that are available in each Region, see Amazon Web Services Global Infrastructure.
